Keywords: Past , Police , Spider-Man Family
Real Name: Miles Morales
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Elevated, Hindering
MY KIND OF ALLIES: When establishing themed teams, characters on your starting force with the Police keyword gain the Spider-Man Family keyword.
CALL IN HELP FROM THE SPIDER-VERSE: When Miles Miles West hits an opposing character, if no character has been placed this turn, after resolutions you may roll a d6. 3-6: Place another friendly character with the Spider-Man Family keyword adjacent.
FASTEST WEBS IN THE WEST: Miles Miles West and adjacent friendly characters can use Shape Change, but only for range attacks. When Miles Miles West or an adjacent friendly character use Shape Change and succeed, after resolutions give the attacker a Webbed Gun token.
NO GUNS IN MY TOWN: Characters With a Webbed Gun token can't make range attacks and have "POWER: Remove all Webbed Gun tokens from this character." Protected: Pulse Wave.

Comments
October 18, 2020
mc268
Wild Wild West is pretty good (unlike his namesake of a movie), he’s mobile, has a full dial of move and attack, end dial outwit, indom, improves targeting a good stats. His worst click is the third where he has to fully rely on incap to do anything. He’s the only character in my collection with four traits and all are pretty good. Spider verse is useful, and his ally trait for police is cool, I don’t really have anyone to use it with, but he can bring Prime singing Batman along for the ride. His webbed guns traits could be huge in some games, or useless in others, but it is completely worth the cost alone for granting shape change from range for your entire team (if you position right). He also brings a good range option for the team. Not to mention that he also brings in the police TA. All in all, a great dial that should always be played with the TMNT 021 Shredder (via Pharaoh). Uncle Phil clears or heals to deal with a problem whenever Will messes up, it’s perfect.
